Photos and all of them Oerstadt looks over -- and we see the intelligence behind eyes for the first time, unmasked. He sits up straight.
Yes. Like that. (smiles) Are you the good cop?  79.
Is that why you did it? Oerstadt thinks ... all pretense of fear gone.

Sure, why not? An angry man, distraught over losing a loved one on the ‘ill fated' Flight 800, blames the military for the disaster and subsequent cover-up. He strikes back through a senseless terrorist act. (shrugs) Tell that to the families, they'll appreciate the closure.
You didn't lose anyone on that flight. Oerstadt taps a finger onto one of the press clippings, p it clear of the pile and slides it over to McCready.
I did. Her name was Melissa Jean Brooks, she was twenty-six years old and she died on that flight. Doug leans over, spins the press clipping around and shov it back at Oerstadt:
No. We already checked with her friends and family. You never knew her. You picked a woman at random on that flight to obsess over, and that's all.
She was the love of my life.
You never even met her. Oerstadt leans forward.
If that plane hadn't gone down ... how do you know I might not have met her? Doug stares back. He has no answer to that. Shakes off th question.
You admit that you set a bomb onto the Orient Point ferry?  80.
Yes, Agent Carlin. I set a bomb onto the Orient Point ferry. A straightforward confession. It's a bit of a shock to al three men.
You don't seem very ... concerned.
Yeah, weird, huh?
How is that?
I don't know. But somehow, I know that I'll never be convicted for any of this. In fact ... I don't think this case will even go to trial. He smiles at Pryzwarra ... then McCready ... then Doug.
Jack McCready stands before the team.
We're shutting you down. Everyone in the lab is stunned.
Will you tell us why?
We've got what we need. The forensics, the suspect, a confession. We're done. Everyone talks at once --
You can't --
We can't stop now --
Sir, I really think we need more evidence to make a conviction stick --
(off Pryzwarra) He's right! (MORE )
DOUG (cont'd) The confession could be ruled inadmissible. We need to keep gathering evidence --
Gathering evidence would have been fine, Agent Carlin, but you went further than that, didn't you? Doug starts to say something, stops -- he has no defense.
We had protocols in place, Agent Carlin. Strict protocols. But you had to push. And now an agent's dead.
That would have happened anyway --
We're done here, people. Power it down, lock your stations, and surrender your cardkeys outside. Experiment's over. McCready marches out, headed for the door --
What about Claire Kuchever? McCready stops.
Charging Oerstadt in the Kuchever murder would raise too many questions about how we obtained the evidence. We can't risk it.
So we're dropping the case?
We have him on the ferry bombing, and killing a Federal Agent. That's enough.
What do we tell her family?
Nothing. Her case will remain open, and her murder will go unsolved --
You can't do that! He's going to kill her in six hours --  82.
He killed her four days ago! You were at her funeral. What's wrong with you? A final look at Doug ... then McCready exits. Doug watche him go ... then turns and glares at Pryzwarra.
Doug marches away from the lab. Pryzwarra catches up to h Doug spins around, about to deck him when --
I swear, Doug, I didn't say anything about the warning!
Then how did he find out?
I don't know -- maybe he fired up the Window four days from now and watched us do it and sent himself a note! I don't know!
Doug's glare softens. He claps Pryzwarra on the shoulder, silent apology. As he turns to go:
Doug ... (Doug waits) It's not your fault Claire dies. Doug tries to smile.
Yeah ... that's one theory. He heads away up the ring. Pryzwarra watches him go.

Denny, Gunnars and Shanti are the last of the team to fin powering down their stations. Shanti glances up at the cl opens a VIDEO FEED WINDOW on her monitor. ON SCREEN: a MEMORIAL SERVICE in progress --

Airman Steven Healy. Patricia Hewitt. Megan Ann Hewitt. Sonar Technician Lamont Hicks.  83. Each name is accompanied by a PHOTOGRAPH -- wedding pictu grade school photos, sailors in uniform. The tally of the dead continues, name after name, THROUGH
The harvest of body bags has grown. More are being added.
Lieutenant Junior Grade Dianne Kerry. Martin Kyle. Commander Francis Lacey, retired. Elaine Lacey ...
Navy divers descend into the murky waters, silhouettes against rippling sunlight.
Chief Petty Officer Darren McAndrews. Lorraine McAndrews. Electronics Technician Lisa Melville. Chaplain Rabbi Benjamin Mendelsson.
A flag at half-mast whipping in a grey wind. Hundreds of people are gathered at the dock in silence, many holding candles, many holding each other.

(over speakers) Seaman Apprentice Clarence Pittman. Coretta Pittman. Duane Pittman. XEROXED PHOTOGRAPHS, HANDWRITTEN POEMS, CRAYON DRAWINGS c every available surface of the dock gates. Beneath them, candles, flowers, several rosaries, a teddy bear.

Operations Specialist Joanne Van Epp. Fireman David Watts. Carol Watts. DOUG stands alone, staring at the memorials, wind whippin his hair. He looks to the horizon -- where a lighthouse stands on the Sound.

The Crime Scene people have left their mark: police tape, evidence markers, etc. Janice's dolls lie in their corner basket. Claire's illustrations remain tacked over her des DOUG stands in the middle of the room, silent.  84.

Doug wanders the kitchen like a fading ghost. He picks up Claire's tomato timer, rolls it in his hand as he walks. He notices the cat bowls at the foot of the refrigerator, empty. Looks up, sees -- the magnetic poetry on the refrigerator door, undisturbed. Four words:

His eyes narrow. Underneath it is one of Claire's sketche girl playing with her dog. The caption reads "Play Dead!" Doug suddenly whips around. He marches through the living room, is running by the time he hits the front door --
Doug speeds through traffic, practicing something aloud.
"Hi, you don't know me ... I'm Special Agent Doug Carlin." (shaking it away) No, shit ...
Dr. Vavala looks up as Doug suddenly strides in --
Agent Carlin! What can I do for you? DOUG. I need to obtain someone's complete medical records. And I need them as quickly as possible.
All right. Whose?
(a beat) Mine.
Doug speaks aloud to no one again:
"What if you had to tell someone the most important thing in the world, but you knew they'd never believe you?" (grins) That could work ...  85.
Doug is at the security gate, the guard at his window:
We were told that the project ended earlier today.
It is ending today, it's still ending, and I'm on my way in there to help it finish ending. The guard hesitates ...
Come on, Kenny, I bought you guys pizza!
Doug strolls a bit too quickly to the outer security door the facility. Swipes his cardkey through the reader --
Come on, come on, still work. A RED LIGHT flashes a zero tone at him.
Shit!
He swipes the card again -- gets the red light again. He' about to try a third time --
Do that one more time, and you set off every alarm they've got. Denny reaches past Doug, swipes his card, gets a green li
The only thing I haven't figured out is... how are you gonna do it? Doug looks surprised ... then walks in without a word. De follows.

Denny moves between stations, activating the Time Window. On his console is a folded-out map of Long Island with on area circled in red. Denny manipulates Shanti's console u the display shows the same area.  86.
We've only got a few minutes before they bust in here and shut us down. Again. Doug stands in front of the Time Window. Apprehensive.
You don't have to do this --

(laughing) Oh yes I do! You're going to try to go back, no matter what I say, correct? (doesn't wait for an answer) If I don't want you to ruin our collider in the process I absolutely have to do this.
What makes you so sure?

(a laugh) You'll see. For some reason, Doug has Claire's tomato timer in his ha He turns it over and over as he waits. Behind him, THE TIME WINDOW ACTIVATES in a burst of stati coalescing, resolving. Doug looks back -- IN THE WINDOW: a view of SEVERAL PEOPLE IN ROBES AND PAJA watching a baseball game on TV?
Is that it? DOUG. Yeah, that's it.
Hah! Unbelievable. Doug takes his gun from under his jacket. Hikes up his pa leg and sticks it into an ankle holster. Hiking up his ot pant leg, he does the same with his Bureau I.D.
Almost ready ... Doug waits, growing restless as the HUM OF MACHINERY arou him increases. He turns the timer in his hands.  87.
Okay. Now?
Yeah. No. Wait ... Doug takes something from under his jacket -- a typewritt sheet of paper -- and pins it to his lapel.
Yeah. (Denny just stares at him) What.
You know ... you're gonna die here. There's no way around that, you are going to die.
I know ... Doug looks sick. Denny keys in the final sequence. Doug starts taking air in shallow gasps, heart pounding. Then

Doctor? (Denny lceoks up) If you ever manage to perfect this thing ... I'd really love to know what happened to that plane. It takes Denny a moment to understand. Then he nods. A SUDDEN BUZZING at the door startles them both. The door remains locked. Someone has just been denied access to th lab by the re-coded security lock. LOUD POUNDING follows. Denny checks his console.
Ten seconds. The HUM of machinery becomes a HIGH WHINE. Doug winds Claire's tomato timer. Puts it into his jacket pocket. MORE POUNDING at the doors.
(faintly) Doug! Doug! Doug closes his eyes as the WINDOW BENDS OUTWARDS, like a sail filling with wind, just as it did with the note.  88.

(barely audible) Don't do it! Don't!!! Doug whispers something under his breath -- it could be a prayer, it could be a curse, we'll never know -- as the WINDOW ENVELOPS HIM -- the LIGHT BECOMES BLINDING, the WH BECOMES DEAFENING -- and at the last moment Doug opens hi eyes and screams ... Suddenly EVERYTHING RECEDES INTO DARKNESS. Denny, the lab all of it becomes A TINY DOT OF WHITE LIGHT and winks out Silence for a moment.
shit!
Get it back.
I'm tryin'. (more silence) Damn remote ... PULL BACK SLOWLY from the darkness, revealing: A dead television screen. On a wall-mounted TV. In what l to be a waiting room .
Populated by people in robes and pajamas. Some of whom ha I.V. bags, all of whom are shouting:
Come on! Get the game back on! What's the problem?
(clicking the remote) I'm tryin'! Damn thing's broken! The man CLICKS the remote -- and a LOUD RINGING STARTS.
What's that? Did it work? But the RINGING sound isn't coming from the television. T Elderly Man turns, listening ...

What is it, Tee? The Elderly Man shuffles toward the RINGING, sees --  89. -- a STONE COLD CORPSE slumped on the floor behind a chai arms limp, skin pale blue. Special Agent Doug Carlin is lying dead in the corner of emergency room at Brookhaven Medical Center. Eyes wide op CLAIRE'S TIMER RINGING in his pocket ... and a sheet of p pinned to his lapel. In big letters:
The group of patients loom over him in disbelief --
Double doors burst open as Doug is wheeled-in on a gurney surrounded by a TRAUMA TEAM. They reach an operating tabl
On three! One -- two -- three! Doug's body lands hard. Doctors tear his shirt open, call out vital signs, prepping the crash cart. One of them tea the paper off of his lapel and does a double take:
Doctor, this looks like his medical history.
What?!
Look, it's one of our forms -- The doctor scans it quickly --
The name's blacked out!

All right, I'm gonna shock him! Stand back everybody -- Clear! -- The Doctor applies the paddles -- DOUG'S POV -- A FLASH OF VISION. Bright lights, doctors shouting ... then it all fades to BLACK. ANOTHER FLASH: Doctors shouting, rush of noise ... and it fades to BLACK. Then ... a FAINT BEEPING, growing louder. Steady. The bee a HEART MONITOR. And light ... hospital lights above.  90.

Doug's eyes open slowly. He's lying on a bed, shirt torn but still fully clothed. He blinks harder, completely disoriented. He stares at -- The heart monitor. Numbers on it keep changing. A RED DIG READOUT. Just like a clock.

A DOCTOR and NURSE walk down the hall -- when Doug bursts through the door and into the hallway. Doug hits the wall opposite them and careens away up the corridor, still groggy but running as fast as he can --
(behind him) Hey! HEY! Clara, call Security, get two orderlies up here now! --

Doug lurches into the stairwell and runs, all but falling down the steps, racing for the first floor -- EXT. BROOKHAVEN MEDICAL —- AMBULANCE BAY - NIGHT TWO PARAMEDICS sit on the bumper of their ambulance, havi smoke. DOUG erupts from a side door. He runs toward them hopping on one leg, pulls a badge from his sock:
Federal Agent! I need a vehicle!
Whoa! Fine, keys are in there!
Ho, wait a minute, you can't take an ambulance, what are you, crazy? Doug hops on his other leg long enough to draw his gun:
I said I need a vehicle! Now!

The Paramedics back off. Doug gets in the driver's side, peels out of the lot in a drunken swerve --  91. INT. AMBULANCE —- NIGHT Doug struggles with the wheel, sideswiping several parked cars as he maneuvers out of the lot and into traffic.
Time, time, what time is it --
The ambulance roars down the highway, passing Exit 34 -- INT. AMBULANCE —- NIGHT Doug plugs a cell phone charger into the dash, powers it
Come on, come on, come on! The face of the cell phone lights up: "07/04 1:07AM"
No! Shit-shit-shit-- He leans on the gas harder, throws the siren on --
Doug's ambulance barrels down the road, siren blaring.

The bungalow door swings open -- Oerstadt's silhouette fi the frame, dragging something behind him. DOUG'S EYES narrow at the wheel. Oerstadt drags A SCREAMING WOMAN across the floor. Her screams are muffled, face hidden under a muslin hood. DOUG makes the turnoff for the Pine Barrens, tires squeal OERSTADT drags the woman over to the metal chair bolted i the floor. Her heels scrape the floor as she screams. DOUG wipes the sweat out of his eyes, squints, searching Oerstadt heaves the woman off the floor -- she gets an ar free and claws at his face. Deep gouges, a rush of blood. punches her in the head -- a BLUE PEARL EARRING falls -- DOUG swerves down a wooded dirt road, fighting panic -- OERSTADT tapes the woman's wrists to the chair -- she struggles, he ignores it --  92. DOUG is lost. He slams the brakes, throws into reverse, wheels spinning dirt, backing up -- DIESEL FUEL pours onto the woman, splashing her hood, dou her clothes -- Oerstadt empties a five-gallon drum over h The woman seizes and gasps, her cries muffled; she's struggling to breathe. Oerstadt looks down at her hands, her splayed fingers: Blood under her nails. He goes to a workbench, takes a pair of GARDEN SHEARS fro its hook. Brings the shears to her fingers until all five between the blades, just above the knuckle. She screams, kicking frenzy, unable to move. He grips the handles, squeezes --

head_text.subj: AND AN AMBULANCE COMES CRASHING THROUGH THE WALL BEHIND H

text: Oerstadt whirls in shock, pelted by splinters and glass. drops to the floor, crawls for cover -- DOUG pushes out of the ambulance, weapon up and out:

Freeze! Federal Agent! He aims into every corner, spinning, searching. Oerstadt is gone. The ambulance lights strobe red-and-whi casting eerie shadows, its headlights shining bright. A FIGURE DARTS THROUGH THE LIGHTS. Doug tracks it --
Doug fires a round. The silhouette freezes --
Oh my gosh ... oh my gosh! I'm sorry! Oerstadt shuffles out of the headlights, hands up, crying

head_text.subj: DON'T KILL ME, DON'T KILL ME, PLEASE

text: And it happens too fast to see: he fires a tazer at Doug. Who catches the wires and yanks, pulling Oerstadt off his feet -- where Doug headbutts him full in the face.  93. Oerstadt staggers, falls back. Doug yanks him forward aga and punches him in the mouth. Oerstadt crashes onto his b
(he kicks Oerstadt over)

Oerstadt rolls over. Doug kicks the tazer away, circles h with his gun -- it's taking everything he has not to shoo this guy. Doug reaches into his jacket for his phone, never taking eyes off Oerstadt -- when suddenly the ambulance dips beh him, its front wheels CRACKING THROUGH THE FLOORBOARDS -- And Oerstadt is on him instantly, slashing with the garde shears, KNOCKING DOUG'S GUN AWAY -- Doug falls, Oerstadt lunges, blades snapping at Doug's fa Doug jumps up onto the hood. Oerstadt bears down with the shears, aiming at Doug's neck -- Doug grabs the blades, holds them open with his bare hand He cries out in pain -- blood appears between his fingers yanks hard to one side -- The blades punch through the metal hood next to Doug's ne ««. and then there's a loud SPLINTERING SOUND, the ambula DIPS VIOLENTLY -—

head_text.subj: THE ENTIRE FLOOR GIVES WAY, TIPPING THE AMBULANCE NOSE-FI

text: Oerstadt rolls off, but Doug falls in -- looks up to see ambulance SLIDING DOWN TO CRUSH HIM. He ducks, it stops s -- but now he's trapped under the vehicle. FRANTIC FOOTSTEPS above. Doug edges out. He hears SOUNDS: something heavy rolling across the floor. Crunching grass door slams, a motor starts. Doug stands up just in time to see TAILLIGHTS DISAPPEAR OUTSIDE. His face goes slack. Oerstadt got away. Failure. Doug retrieves his gun -- then whirls -- The woman is still taped to the chair. Hooded and bound. Doug approaches. She turns suddenly beneath the hood, her breath freezing at his approach.  94. Doug halts, a mix of fear and wonder. Is it really her? He reaches for the hood -- stops suddenly to wipe his fac and fix his hair, a kid on a prom date, ridiculous moment reaches for the hood again. The SHADOW OF HIS HAND brings a whimper from the woman. Doug takes the hood in his fingers and lifts ... revealin duct tape ... lifts it off of her face completely ... Douglas Carlin and Claire Anne Kuchever stare into each other's eyes for the first time. Doug is breathless.
Jesus, you're real. Claire SCREAMS THROUGH THE TAPE, eyes bright with terror
No=-no-no, IT'S OKAY, IT'S ALL RIGHT! Look, I'm a Federal Agent! -- wait -- (fumbles with his jacket, thrusts his I.D. at her) I'm a Federal Agent! I'm here to get you out, it's okay, he's gone!
Claire's screams trail off into violent sobbing. Doug pul the tape off of her mouth --
I will, I promise! Hold still -- Doug peels at the tape around her wrists but can't get hi fingers under it. He scratches at it, fumbling. Claire's tears subside. He smiles awkwardly at her.
Just be a minute. Hi...
Hi...
I'm Doug Carlin ...
Claire Kuchever.
Hi... He shakes her bound hand, a dainty little tug. Then looks her fingers and smiles -- all ten still there.
Where is he? Did you catch him?

No. He drove off ... (a beat, it hits him) In your car. Doug ponders that for a moment. Which is when THE INCENDI BOMB GOES OFF BEHIND HIM. FIRESHOT scatters through what's left of the bungalow. TH FLOOR IGNITES AT ONCE, flames running across spilled fuel
Oh my God -- !! Doug claws at the tape, Claire strains at her bonds --
me out! a2 It e! Doug looks around, frantic -- the wrecked ambulance prote them from the blast but now it's burning, too --
a2 Ha
Doug runs through the flames, jumps onto the burning ambulance. Pulls at the GARDEN SHEARS buried in the hood
with the shears -- Everything around Claire is on fire. Doug races back to h
Okay, pull up on your arms! As hard as you can! Claire cringes -- Doug cuts away the tape from her arms, ankles.
Now don't run or you'll catch fire! Wait! Okay?
Okay!  96. He pulls her to her feet. They scan the room together. TH PLACE IS AN INFERNO. They have seconds to live.
Grab my neck! Both arms, that's it -—- Here we go! -- Doug hauls Claire off the floor and runs into the flames, carrying her like a bride through a burning houses
Cover your face, don't look! Claire buries her face against him -- he runs for the ope front wall -- everything is burning, everything's falling
Doug pulls Claire out of the bungalow just as the AMBULAN EXPLODES, throwing both of them to the ground. Doug rolls of Claire; they sit up, gasping for breath.
Are you all right?
Uh-huh ... Yeah. I'm okay. Thank you. Claire takes a breath, trying to compose herself. Doug st at her. She notices his gaze. Manages a brief smile.
I'm okay. Really ...
Sorry, I'm just amazed that you're ... okay.
No kidding ... (she looks around) Where is this?
The middle of the Pine Barrens. About forty miles from your house.
Forty miles from -- (she looks at him) You know where I live? Oops. Doug nods.
You're a marshal?  97.
FBI, Special Agent.
And -- I'm sorry, you told me your name but I was so --
It's okay! You were busy. It's Doug. Doug stands, gazes out into the woods, worried. She looks into the darkness.
What ... who did this? (it starts to flood out of her) And why? And why me?
Take it easy --
What did I do?
Claire -- you didn't do anything. All right? None of this is your fault. Let's just get you away from here.
Doug crawls into Oerstadt's Jeep, pulls open the steering column. Goes to work hot-wiring the ignition.
Just be a minute ... Claire stares at the bullet holes in the windshield.
(spooked) Take your time. A spark -- the engine turns over --
Claire stares out the window as they drive through the ni barely lit by the glow of the dashboard.
Where are we going?
Back to your house.  98.
Not to the police?
(hesitates) You're covered in gasoline. I'll get you home, and then let me handle the police. Claire looks down at her clothes. It suddenly hits her:
Oh God. Oh God. I could have died back there ... I should be dead right now.
Don't say that!
I should be dead ...
No, Claire ... you escaped, you got away from the bad guy. You survived, you're going to be all right. Doug looks at Claire, into her eyes.
I know. (beat) It was a close call. And now... it's in the past.
Doug and Claire enter. Claire's cat runs under the couch.
Ginger! Hey, Gigi, it's okay ... (to Doug) She always runs away the first time she meets someone --— Doug crouches, coaxing the cat from under the couch.
Come on out, lil' scruff --
(laughing) That's so funny, I call her that -- Her smile freezes for a moment, but Doug doesn't notice. Claire smiles again when he looks up at her.  99.
Here she comes! Hey, kitty ... He reaches out, scratches the cat's ears.
Oh, no wonder she's spooked -- I still smell like a tanker truck! (she laughs) Do you mind if I change?
Of course not. I'll get you a glass of water?
Sure. I'll just be a minute.
Okay.

Doug fills two glasses at the sink. Glances at the counte next to the refrigerator, blinks -- there's nothing there He pulls the tomato timer from his pocket. Stares at the where he'll find it tomorrow ... a spot which is now empt He puts the tomato timer in that exact spot, then steps b He snorts in sudden laughter, giddy at the paradox. Doug can't help himself, goes to the refrigerator. Rearra the magnetic poetry to read, ‘YOU CAN SAVE HER.' Smiles - The sound of A WASHING MACHINE calls his attention -- he heads back into the living room --
Doug sets two glasses down. Claire drops the lid on her closet washer and comes in from the hallway.
Thanks for letting me change. I guess I'm all right now, if you need to go.
I can stay a few minutes if -—- Doug's face goes dead slack. She's changed into the same summer dress she was found dead in.
That dress!  100.
What?
That dress! Don't wear that! She stares at him. Doug catches himself.
I'm sorry. I know this sounds weird, but ... you should put on something else. A different color. Red, you have a red and white dress, right?
Okay ...
I'm sorry -- there was ... a victim on this case, who wore a dress like that.
Oh. That's understandable. I'll be right out. She disappears into the bedroom again. Doug shakes his he
(under his breath) Shit, Carlin, when did you get so sloppy?
Doug? Could you come in here for a moment?
Sure -- Doug walks into Claire's bedroom --

-- and Claire BASHES Doug across the back of the head wit porcelain vase, SHATTERING it. Doug falls onto the bed, dazed. Claire lunges at him, gra his holster. He rolls over, she screams, pulls his gun fr
Doug fights to not pass out. Claire's got both hands on t gun, two fingers on the trigger, and she is terrified.  101.
(breathing hard) I'm calling the police!
I am the police ...
No you're not! You're not! You didn't ask me any questions -- you didn't take a statement -- you didn't even have a car! And you knew where my house was, and my cat's name, and what's in my closet?
Claire ...
Can I sit up? I'm not going to do anything. Claire doesn't answer. Doug sits up slowly.
I am a Federal Agent ... part of a special investigative unit. We're working a terrorism case, tracking the man who tried to kill you.
How do I know that? How do I know you're not him? I had a hood over my head!
(thinks about it) Look at my face. You scratched his face, right? Claire nods, starts to look doubtful.
I wanna see your I.D. again.
Doug enters ahead of Claire. Starts to go to his jacket -
No! Go sit down. There -- on the couch. (MORE )

CLAIRE (cont'd) (an idea) Sit on your hands! Doug can't help but smile -- this lady has seen her cop shows. He sits on his hands, as directed. Claire digs int his jacket, pulls out his cardkey, risks a glance at it.
This says Brookhaven National Laboratory.
The other one. Claire puts the cardkey in her skirt pocket. She digs aga pulls out his FBI badge. Glances at the picture. Picks up phone, hits '0O.'
(filtered) Operator --
Yes, please connect me to the Long Island Field Office of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, please. Doug waits, nervous -- how's this gonna go?
(filtered) Long Island Field Office, this is Agent Donnelly.
Yes, is there an Agent Douglas Carlin working out of that branch?
Ah, yes there is, but he's not here at the moment, would you like to leave a message?
Please ask him to call me back, at 462- 8423.
Oops, wait a sec, phone pad's empty. Doug has an idea:
(softly) Ask him to call me on my cell phone.  103.
Pardon me, Agent Donnelly? Could you try him on his cell? It's important.

Ah, okay, please hold -- A click on the line as she's put on hold. Doug smiles gri waiting. A moment later -- Doug's cell phone RINGS in his jacket. Claire checks: the caller display on the cell phone reads FBI LI FIELD OFC. locks eyes with Doug. The ringing STOPS.
I'm afraid he's not available.
I'll try back later. Goodbye. She hangs up. Lowers the gun ... holds it with two finger offers it to him.
I'm sorry ... Doug stands, a little woozy ... takes the gun. DOUG. Don't be. It was the right thing to do.
(wincing at the sight of his head wound) Are you okay?
Claire has a bottle of disinfectant and some cotton balls Doug sits on the edge of the tub. Claire dabs at the back his head, throws the cotton ball in the trash.
The man who attacked you is Carroll Oerstadt. He's planning to blow up the Orient Point ferry.
Oh my God.
It'll be all right. I know his plan. I know exactly where he's going to be and what he's going to do.  104.
How do you know that? How did you know those things about me? Doug thinks it over -- where to start? He looks at her.
What if you had to tell someone the most important thing in the world, but you knew they'd never believe you?
I'd try. You don't know for sure what someone might believe. She dabs his head again, throws another cotton ball away.
(a beat) You won't believe me, but ... Just for the sake of argument, let's pretend that the FBI has this special device, and that I know what's going to happen in the next six hours.
I don't believe you. (catches herself, smiles) Wow. I guess your first prediction just came true. Claire dabs his head again, throws the cotton ball away.
It'd make things a lot easier if you just go with me on that --

(a sudden thought) Wait a second. If you know what's going to happen, how come you didn't you know I was going to hit you? Doug pauses -- good question. Claire smiles (gotcha!) and throws another cotton ball away -- Doug glances down at the wastebasket. It hits him. Cotton balls with blood on them.
Oh, no. No.
What?  105.
Doug stares at the pieces of the broken vase:
Shit. I haven't changed a thing ...
Doug comes in, stares at the two glasses (with his fingerprints on them). He closes his eyes, trying to thin things through ... comes to a decision. One he doesn't li
Claire ... you have to come with me.
What? (backs away from him) I thought you said I was safe!
I was wrong. Claire, I do know what's going to happen, some things, anyway. (looks at her) I have to go ... and I can't leave you alone. That brings fear to Claire's eyes.

Claire ... just ... look at me. There's no argument I can make that will get you to believe me. But can you just look at me, and see that I'm telling the truth? Claire looks at him... her expression softens a bit. As bizarre as this is, she does believe him -- The phone RINGS. Claire moves to answer it:
Wait, don't answer that! Let me prove this -- let the machine pick it up. (a beat) Okay, now that's your friend Beth calling. Right? To check up on you after your blind date.
How do you know that ...? Claire's machine clicks and plays her outgoing message:  106.
(on the machine) Hello! This is 462-8423. I'm sorry I missed your call ...
Okay now, watch me -- listen to Beth leave her message and watch my lips -- Claire frowns. Her machine BEEPS -- and Doug lip-synchs exactly the words that Beth says over the speaker.

Claire? Hi, it's Beth, are you there? I'm sorry to call so late, but you said you were going to call me when you got home, and when you didn't, I started to get worried -- He does it complete with gestures -- utterly ridiculous c moment -- Claire pulls the phone off its base --
(into phone) Is this a joke?
What? No! I was worried about you, that's all. How'd the date go --
I can't talk right now, someone's here. I'll call you tomorrow.
Claire -- ! Claire hangs up the phone. Doug looks at her imploringly.
Believe me. The only place you're safe is with me. Claire stares. Comes to a decision. One she doesn't like.
What do we have to do?
Doug drives. Claire, in the passenger seat, peppers him w questions.
Why not just call the police and just arrest him at the ferry?  107.
I've seen the plans for the bomb. There's a remote detonation device. If we confront him, we're just killing a different group of people.
So, arrest him before he gets to the ferry?
In the city? (shakes his head) I don't know where he is, until he gets to the ferry. Then it's too late. No, the safest way to separate him from the bomb ... is to let him put it in place.
You know how to defuse a bomb?
(smiles) I do that one. Claire shakes her head; it's all too wild ... but she is fascinated.
So ... you said you were part of a special surveillance unit. (Doug nods) And you've been watching me? (Doug nods) What else do you know about me? Doug grows quiet. He sighs.
Everything ... He glances over at her.

I know that you support yourself as a children's book illustrator. I know that eight months ago your fiancé suddenly broke it off and refused to return your phone calls. I know that you've been turned down by three adoption agencies since January because they won't place a child with a single woman on a freelance income. Claire gasps.  108.

I know that you put your Explorer up for sale because you've given up on ever having a big family. And that you say grace before meals even when you dine alone. That you write poems in your Christmas cards. That you love Cary Grant movies. That you got stood up tonight. (beat) And I know that you dance with your cat sometimes, when it's late and you've been alone all day. Claire is blown away. Doesn't know what to say.
You know all those things about me ... I don't know anything about you.
I'm... I'm a guy who likes the fact you do all those things. They share a smile. Doug looks back at the road. Which lets Claire study his face ...
Doug parks the Jeep on a side street, well away from the ferry. Angles it in behind a large DUMPSTER. DOUG. We can walk from here.
Why here?
We can't let Oerstadt see his own car. We want him to think everything is going perfectly.

Flags tied to cars and strollers, couples hand in hand, scores of FAMILIES with cameras and kids in tow. DOUG AND CLAIRE keep watch on the ferry from a safe dista standing next to a cotton candy stand. The dock is crammed with PEOPLE AND VEHICLES -- rows of c RV's and trucks in line to board the Sea Bride. Suddenly Claire's breath catches:  109.
There. Look. IN THE AUTO CUE, Oerstadt rides by in Claire's Explorer, heading into the parking deck.
Yeah. That's him. Claire stares at her killer's face for the first time, quietly terrified.

Oh God. Just like you said ... FERRY WORKERS wave a military transport vehicle into the deck through an open BOW DOOR. Other cars follow -- -- including Oerstadt, driving off the dock and onto the ferry, passing by a waiting SHUTTLE BUS. Doug and Claire watch from outside, waiting.
No. Forget it. We need to call the police --
No --
All these people --

Claire ... in a minute Oerstadt is going to get off that ferry. He's going to get on that shuttle bus, and ride it out to the tip of Orient Point. There he's going watch the ferry from shore as it sails out of trigger range, then he'll wait to see the bomb go off. AT THE FERRY, Oerstadt appears. Scans the crowd.

If at any point before that, he suspects anything, he will set it off immediately. Oerstadt wears his camera bag, stands with one hand in hi pocket. Then walks purposefully through the crowd, straig toward the shuttle bus ... and gets on. Claire lets out her breath. But Doug waits, still watchin Claire looks at him, questioningly. Doug still waits --  110. AT THE FERRY, the shuttle PULLS AWAY. Doug smiles.
Doug escorts Claire to the Dock Authority.
Twenty-two minutes after the ferry leaves, it's going to pass a Coast Guard cutter. We'll hail the cutter and evacuate everyone from the ferry, then I'll disarm the bomb.
Will you have enough time?
It's the only time we've got. Claire starts to protest --
We're trying to cheat fate here, Claire. This guy's got everything else covered. They reach the door.
Do I tell them about you?
Me, the bomb, everything -- including where to find Oerstadt now. Show them the Jeep if they don't believe you. Just wait until after the ferry's well underway.
Doug, I know this sounds silly, but .»-. I'll say a prayer for you. Doug smiles and grasps her hand.
Stay ridiculously safe. I'll see you later. Doug heads off toward the ferry. Claire watches him go.

Oerstadt rides along, gazes absently out his window -- an then the bus suddenly STOPS. Oerstadt leans, tries to loo ahead to see what happened --  111. THE BUS DRIVER frowns, looking ahead -- THROUGH THE WINDOW, there is roadwork in the way; a large orange sign reads DETOUR. The Bus Driver sighs, turns the big wheel ...

Again the bus comes to a stop. A large MOVING VAN blocks road ahead. Oerstadt gazes out the window -- He's looking down the exact street where Doug and Claire his Jeep. He can't see it though, because the Jeep is wel hidden behind the dumpster. But just then, a GARBAGE TRUCK moves its forks into place beneath the dumpster, and LIFTS IT UP -- -- giving Oerstadt a brief glimpse of his shattered Jeep, parked along the street. Oerstadt stares.
CLOSE ON: A doll, floating face down in the water -- we'r right back to the opening of our story. At the rail above, Janice looks down. Beth pulls her away
Don't worry, baby, we'll get you another one ... Beth and Janice merge into the crowd -- as DOUG pushes pa them, stepping onto the ferry.
A wide foyer with ticket windows, long benches, waiting passengers. Claire, visibly nervous, paces near the Polic Help Desk. The DESK CLERK looks up at her:
Can I help you?

(glancing up at the clock) Not for another ten minutes, thank you. She moves away. The Desk Clerk watches her an odd moment, then turns to help another customer. Claire pauses at the windows, looks out at the ferry --  112. -- as Oerstadt hurries past the window, heading back to t boarding ramp. Claire jumps back. A million thoughts race through her he what to do? She looks toward the Police Desk, then back o to the ferry -- EXT. BOARDWALK — DAY Claire steps out of the building. In the crowd ahead, the Oerstadt, moving quickly onto the ferry. Claire agonizes in quiet terror. Comes to a decision. Cur under her breath ... and RUNS toward the boarding ramp.
A group of ELDERLY VETERANS with potbellies and thick gla greet several YOUNGER, LONG-HAIRED VETS with hugs and backslaps. CLAIRE moves past, searching for a way down to auto level. Suddenly:
Claire! Claire spins, mortified. Janice is waving her arms:
Claire! Look, Mom, it's Claire! Claire shakes her head no, backs away. Beth spots her.
Claire, over here! Claire! People are turning to look now. Claire spins, frantic, sp a gangway -- dodges through the crowd, disappears. Beth frowns.
Huh! Wonder what that was all about? Beth turns away -- her, looking after Claire. He steps forward, following he
The FERRY CAPTAIN looks out through the forward windows. Behind him, the pilot looks over his shoulder:
Five minutes past the hour, sir. The Captain nods. THE HORN SOUNDS --  113.
The Sea Bride cuts a wake as it churns past the Orient Po Lighthouse, heading out into Long Island Sound.

Doug stands along the ship's rail as the ship passes the lighthouse. He checks his watch: DOUG. Damn. Running late already ... He edges past the GROUP OF KINDERGARTNERS and their teach finds a ladder and climbs out of view -- -- just as CLAIRE steps onto the walkway, too late to see him. She hurries by, casting glances behind her --
Well underway, the ferry passes a COAST GUARD CUTTER. The cutter's crew waves to the holiday crowd; the ferry passengers wave back. A FANFARE STRIKES --
Doug taps on the glass door to the ferry's control cabin. men inside are startled; one of them comes to the door:
Sir, this area is off-limits --
(flashing his I.D.) I'm a Federal Agent, this is an emergency. I need to speak to the Captain.
What emergency?
Captain, I need you to hail that cutter we just passed and advise them that there may be a bomb onboard -- tell them to come alongside --
What?!
Jesus --  114.

We're gonna need to evacuate every one of these people -- As he gestures at the Sun Deck below him, Doug naturally glances down -- and sees OERSTADT on deck, walking past t Navy band, intent on something out of view. Doug's eyes go wide in utter disbelief.
(going on behind him) In the middle of the Sound? Onto a cutter half our size?! I'm not hailing anyone until you tell me exactly how you know --
Never mind.
And where it's -- what?

Never mind! You're right -- don't do anything until I confirm the threat. Understand? Don't do anything differently! I'll be right back! Doug vaults down the ladder. The Captain and Pilot look a each other, then the Captain grabs the conn mike:
Calling any Coast Guard, calling any Coast Guard, this is CSF Sea Bride, please come in, over --
FILLED WITH PEOPLE -- reading, playing cards, scolding th kids, eating hot dogs -- CLAIRE ducks in, glancing behind her, weaving through the crowded tables towards the back exit --

A NAVY BAND -- two dozen sailors in dress whites -- plays John Philip Sousa tune for the passengers. Above them han banner, ‘WELCOME SUBASE NEW LONDON FAMILIES!' Aman in a wheelchair sleeps next to a kid in a stroller. Doug lands on the deck next to them, moves past —-  115.
Claire emerges from the restaurant as a FERRY WORKER (the game guy we saw smoking at the opening) passes by. She touches his arm -—-
Excuse me, how would I get down to the car deck from here?
Car deck's closed, ma'am.
Yes, I know that but -- He walks away without listening. Claire watches, turns aw ++. and walks into OERSTADT, who stands before her, smili

You're looking for the car deck, miss? I can show you where that is. Claire seizes in terror. He smiles, friendly in the confidence that she can't possibly know who he is. Claire realizes he thinks she doesn't know him. Tries to her voice even.

Can you? I left my purse in my car. She forces her eyes up to his. Meets his gaze. He looks straight into her soul. His smile melts. Frozen moment. Oerstadt's sudden lunge for her, and the struggle that follows, is masked by THE CRASH OF CYMBALS and A JOHN PHI SOUSA TUNE from the deck band --
Doug spins, pacing through the crowd. He passes the band suddenly notices something out on the water -- In the distance, THE COAST GUARD CUTTER TURNS, coming bac around pursue the ferry.
No, no, no, damn it ...! Doug checks his watch, gives the deck one last look for Oerstadt. Pushes off the rail and runs down the walkway -  116.

Over a hundred vehicles parked end-to-end, on two levels along the keel and down four center lanes. Doug vaults a chain barrier. Looks around: the parking ba seems deserted, all the cars empty. Doug pulls his gun. Edges through the parking bay, trying keep hidden while searching for the Explorer. Not an easy task -- there are military vehicles and at least one scho bus obscuring his views. He hears something -- someone trying to strike a flint, o and over. Doug comes around a vehicle with his gun -- Surprising the Ferry Worker, trying to light his cigarett
Aaaa! What the --
Get out. Now. The Ferry Worker scrambles to his feet, runs out of the b Doug never gives him a second glance --

head_text.subj: ON THE SECOND LEVEL HULL RAMP

text: Claire's Explorer rests on an incline above the main car deck, three cars away from the hydraulic door-ramp that l to open water -- -- and ten feet above Doug, who stands looking up at it. MOMENTS LATER -- Doug is on the second level, edging towa the vehicle. He glances at the bumper -- the license plat has been removed. He looks through the back window -- FOUR ORANGE BARRELS inside. He looks through the front windshield. Where his eyes meet CLAIRE'S, staring back at him in wet terror, wrists bound to the steering column, duct tape ov her mouth, a thin whine building in her throat --

CLAIRE! Jesus --— He claws at the door handle -- -- when TWO TAZER WIRES fire into his back, zapping him i a seizure. Doug jerks spasmodically, drops the gun, falls over the rail --  117. Doug lands on a car, shattering its windshield. He's on h back, eyelids fluttering at the edge of consciousness -- DOUG'S POV - the underside of Claire's car -- and OERSTAD wearing an orange life vest, looking down at him from the ramp above. Oerstadt reaches into his camera bag, no hurry. Pulls out pipe bomb. Doug moans, tries to move -- Oerstadt pounds t pipe bomb once on the rail, and tosses it at him -—- Doug slides off the hood just as the pipe bomb falls thro the shattered windshield. THE CAR EXPLODES, debris flying Doug slides under a military transport truck, crawling fo his life. Another pipe bomb pounds the rail, another toss
ON THE RAMP, Oerstadt holds another pipe bomb but can't s which car Doug is hiding under. The PARKING DECK IS FILLI

Doug crawls beneath another vehicle, trying to make his w back under the ramp. A POOL OF BURNING FUEL spreads after -- another pipe bomb falls, EXPLODES -- CLAIRE glares out the windshield as Oerstadt walks by her window -- he bends out of view, comes up with Doug's gun, paces in front of the vehicle, looking for Doug -- Claire struggles to pull her wrists free of the wheel, he fingers straining to reach the GEAR SHIFT, just out of re DOUG drags himself out from under a station wagon, climbs onto it. Oerstadt paces above -- Doug sees his chance, leaps for the overhanging ramp abov and grabs the edge. He pulls himself up -- -- and finds himself staring into the barrel of his own g Doug hangs there in resignation -- it's over. Oerstadt stares at him, about to fire --
I have a message for you... from Melissa Jean Brooks. Oerstadt blinks, momentarily dumbstruck.
What?

Go to Hell.  118. Oerstadt's shock becomes sudden fury -- he aims the gun i Doug's forehead -- -- as Claire suddenly pulls the Explorer out of gear and rolls into him from behind, knocking him off-balance. Oerstadt spins and falls hard, his camera bag slamming in the rail with A METALLIC BANG -- -- and with THE DISTINCTIVE SOUND OF ONE OF OERSTADT'S PI BOMBS SUDDENLY PRIMING. He and Doug exchange looks.
Oh my gosh -- OH MY GOSH!!! Oerstadt struggles with the camera bag but it's stuck on shoulder. OTHER PIPE BOMBS SPILL ONTO THE RAMP, rolling d the incline toward the big hydraulic door --

Doug drops to the floor and rolls for cover -- OERSTADT EXPLODES, taking half the second level ramp with him. The cars between Claire's Explorer and the bay door SPILL AND TUMBLE off of the ramp, landing on the cars bel Doug rolls to his feet, checks his watch -- It's 10:45. Another explosion rocks the entire deck, BLOWING THE FORW CAR RAMP HALFWAY OPEN TOWARDS THE WATER, exposing a swath sky and a rolling horizon. Doug runs back under where the upper ramp is still solid, climbs onto it --
Claire! Claire!! He runs along the edge to the Explorer. Pulls out Claire' keys, unlocks her passenger door and gets in --
Claire is still bound to the wheel, a roll of duct tape o the seat beside her. Doug tears it from her mouth --
(gasping) . I'm sorry! I saw him get on and I didn't know what to do -- I had to warn you -——  119.
It's okay! You just saved my life! (he smiles, pulls at her taped wrists) Are you all right?
I'm okay -- (she tries to make a joke) How come whatever we do, we end up like this?
Doug freezes at that. He looks at his watch -- 10:46 now.
Less than two minutes ...
Two minutes ...? (then) Oh my God! Can you stop it?
Not enough time. He gets her hands free, starts to work on her ankles --
Help me, hurry!
(pulling at the tape) What are we gonna do? What do we do? He leans over with her keys, puts them in the ignition an turns the motor over.
You are gonna get topside as fast as you can -- He cranks it again -- the MOTOR STARTS.
I'll take care of this!
How -- ? Suddenly they're interrupted by the CRACKLE OF A BULLHORN
Doug and Claire spin, look out her window:  120. COAST GUARDSMEN flood the parking deck, take position, weapons drawn and ready to fire.

head_text.subj: PUT YOUR HANDS IN THE AIR AND STEP OUT

text: Doug and Claire look at each other in complete dread.
Claire looks to Doug. Doug shakes his head no, whispers:
If we get out of this car, everybody dies. Claire swallows, fighting panic:
What do we do ...?

head_text.subj: YOU HAVE TILL THE COUNT OF THREE

text: (beat)

They're nearly surrounded now. Doug and Claire look forwa out the windshield, at the only clear path left: The open bay door, what's left of the car ramp, the wide ocean beyond. They look into each other's eyes, a shared moment.

Two! Doug slides over in the seat, closes his hands over hers the wheel. Claire steps on the gas, revving the engine to high idle. The Coast Guardsmen shout to each other ... And suddenly the CAR RADIO snaps on all by itself.

(filtered) It's ten forty-eight on Endless Summer Sunday ... now let's go back in time to 1964 and the Beach Boys! On Long Island's 98 FM -- Doug pops the gear shift into DRIVE and Claire floors it.  121.

The Explorer's wheels spin smoke on the metal ramp and it shoots forward, jumping the jagged edge and clipping seve cars beneath it. The Coast Guard OPEN FIRE -- the Explorer races up the bo door like a boat over a stunt ramp and LAUNCHES OUT INTO
The Explorer bursts from the ferry's bow like a cannon sh Its wheels spin in mid-air -- its nose dips, plows into t water --
Doug and Claire are thrown into the dashboard, nearly out their seats --

The Explorer bobs in the water and comes to rest ... not sinking. Seeming like it won't. Then -- THE FERRY'S BOW SMASHES into the side of the car and plow over it, SHRIEKING METAL-ON-METAL, forcing it underwater
Doug and Claire tumble like socks in a dryer, rolling wit the submerged car -- THE BARRELS ROLL AND SMASH INTO EACH OTHER, rupturing, splashing fuel all over Claire's back -
Well, it's been building up inside of me for, Oh, I don't know how long --
The Explorer SCRAPES AND ROLLS ALONG THE KEEL as if tumbl down a mountain upside-down -- the side windows SHATTER A
I don't know why, but I keep thinkin’ Somethin's bound to go wrong...

SEAWATER ENGULFS THEM. Claire can't see. Her breath escap in a rush of bubbles, she's panicking -- DOUG'S HAND appears, pulls her to the door, to the window it's open -- she flails and kicks through broken glass --  122. -- clawing for the surface as the ferry passes overhead, churning, deafening, so far above -- she'll never make it she's too far down, starts choking -- and beneath her -- THE BOMB EXPLODES.

Claire is hurled up through white water and ERUPTS FROM T FERRY'S WAKE. She tumbles end-over-end in a SLOW MOTION F FALL high over the Sound, limp, weightless, plummeting. She hits the water face-first in a TREMENDOUS SPLASH and disappears into the simmering water. It closes over her, smoothes out, becomes still. CLAIRE'S BODY floats to the surface, hanging face down in dark green water. It bobs there, hair waving in easy ripp not moving. Floating wreckage, flames on the water. Stillness. Then - Claire convulses, head thrown back in a wrenching gasp. S takes air in huge breaths, coughing, sputtering, violent life -- struggles to tread water as a SHADOW PASSES over -- and suddenly THREE COAST GUARD CREWMEN splash into the water around her. Arms across her chest pull her into a b float, away to safety.

Claire is brought onto the deck with other FERRY PASSENGE more are still coming aboard, coughing and sooty. Behind the ferry BURNS; FIREBOATS spray water into its bow as bl smoke billows forth. Claire doesn't hear any of it, just sits trembling. Her h shake as she brings them up and stares at them ... Ten fingers, all fine. She pulls her hair away from her eyes, blinking. As she d her eyes focus on something, something in the distance. Out there, in a pool of burning fuel -- DOUG'S BODY lies face up in the tide. His eyes are lifele his body blackened; his legs and lower torso are in flame There can be no question that he's dead. CLAIRE watches, frozen. Doug sways with the waves, then begins SLOWLY SINKING FRO VIEW, one arm floating out at a cruel angle. Just before vanishes forever, we see Doug's hand.  123. All five fingers have been sheared away, leaving ragged stumps. The water closes over him completely, then ripples and smoothes out, until only flames remain.
In shock. She blinks, trembling. Her eyes begin to fill. Then suddenly she's surrounded -- an oxygen mask is place over her mouth -- MEDICS are there, calming her, checking out, pulling her away ...
The cutter has docked; ferry passengers are unloaded as E WORKERS and NEWS CREWS swarm the pier. Claire wanders dow the ramp, dazed. Stops at a familiar voice --
Claire? Claire! (to Janice) Honey, look, there she is! It's Beth and Janice. Janice runs up to Claire, slams int her. Claire barely flinches, still in shock.

Claire ... ire. (Claire looks at her) My God, you're drenched. What happened? Are you all right? Claire's eyes focus. She looks down at Janice, looks arou A SMOKING FERRY WORKER is coming down the ramp, helping a in a wheelchair. Next to them a kid in a stroller is also being wheeled down, still sleeping. At the base of the ramp, a harried TEACHER tries to get a head count as her KINDERGARTNERS crowd around her. Nearby
-- we don't know yet, ma'am, please, we don't know --
My daughter's on that ferry, oh God my daughter--!
Just let us ask, maybe they're here, Maybe someone saw them --  124.

(suddenly a gasp) Chrissie! The teacher spins at hearing her name, smiles as the elde couple rush over to meet her. Around them OTHER PARENTS r to the group and to their own children ... +. as the SHELL-SHOCKED WOMAN runs across the blacktop to embrace her husband ... ++. and the GROUP OF CADETS exchanges hugs and backslaps the NAVY BAND, all of them laughing now. CLAIRE sees it all, an epiphany of gratitude and relief. Everyone who had died before is fine. Everyone.
So was he the man of your dreams? Claire spins.
What ...?
The guy you met. Last night? Suddenly Claire can't speak. But she nods "Yes."
Claire, I'm sorry but I have to call David and let him know we're okay ...
That's okay -- Go! Oh, and Beth? (Beth turns) Can you call my parents for me?

(smiles) Of course! (taking Janice) Come on, baby, we're gonna call Daddy. Janice looks back; Claire smiles and gives her a wave. Claire watches them go, off together across the blacktop past the families, past Search and Rescue vehicles, past black FBI car where DOUG IS STANDING WATCHING THE DOCK -— Claire gasps so violently she nearly faints. It's Doug. The Doug who we saw in the opening scene, who never been through the Time Window ... who has never met Claire.  125. He stands by his car, watching the dock, taking it all in Just as he did before.

OH GOD! -- oh God, oh God! -- Claire struggles to breathe, ready to pass out -- Doug is talking to ANDY PRYZWARRA, who has just introduce himself. Doug asks him to step aside slightly and looks o over the dock again. Pryzwarra scans the dock with him.
What are we looking for?
Anything that doesn't belong. Doug notices a shell-shocked woman -- CLAIRE this time -- standing alone. She's staring at him, drenched and trembl
Claire sways on her feet. Doug is looking at her now. Cla doesn't move.

Doug looks unsettled -- that woman is still staring at hi He stares back, curious now. Doug heads over to an EMS worker, grabs a blanket. Claire's breath freezes -- because now he’s walking TOWAR HER. Claire doesn't move. Doug walks right up to Claire and puts the blanket around shoulders:
It's all right, miss. You're in shock. AND CLAIRE BREAKS DOWN, crying so hard she can't speak. S throws her arms around Doug and weeps into his neck, bawl
It's okay. You're okay now. Doug puts his arms around her, awkwardly, bewildered.
I don’t understand!  126.
Shh, shhhh ... you're gonna be fine. She starts to calm down in his arms. Over her shoulder, D sees a group of RED CROSS VOLUNTEERS, waves to one of the behind Claire's back. Takes Claire that way.
Miss, these people can help you --
No! She clings to him, he pulls her hands away --
It's okay, you're going to be fine.
No, wait!
Look, you're safe, I have to go back over there --
Doug! Doug stops -- she knows his name? Claire gathers herself:
What would you do ... if you had to tell someone the most important thing in the world ... but you knew they'd never believe you? She stands open to him, still in tears.
(suspicicus now) Do you have something to tell me about what happened here today? Claire swallows, finally nods. Doug considers, looks arou
Okay. Okay. Hold that thought. He takes her arm. They walk together -- Doug brings her o to his car, opens the passenger door for her --
Watch your head, that's it ...  127.

The door cuts off sound from outside. Claire watches thro the windshield as Doug goes to Pryzwarra and confers sile with him, pointing at Claire. As she watches, she feels something in her dress pocket, takes it out: A BROOKHAVEN LAB CARDKEY bearing Doug's name and photo, tomorrow's date clearly visible. Claire stares at it, beginning to comprehend. She hides the card as Doug slides behind the wheel.
You're not under arrest, but I'm going to need to take a statement -- As he keys the ignition his CAR RADIO STARTS -- he reache for the knob but stops mid-reach:

She told me, "Baby, when you race today Just take along my love with you ... And if you knew how much I love you, Baby, nothin’ could go wrong with you..." Doug stares at the radio, transfixed somehow. Claire watc him. Does he know? Does he remember? Doug turns to Claire, looks at her as if seeing her for t first time. It's almost as if he knows her somehow but ca figure out how. A look of deja vu. Claire looks into his eyes. (Does he know? Does he rememb Doug looks away, dazed, then notices something new. He lo out through the windshield, out at the sky.
What is it? Doug blinks, unsettled.
It was supposed to be raining by now. Claire looks out the window -- it's a bright blue sky, no cloud anywhere. She shrugs:
I guess God changed His mind. They look at each other.  128.
Their car heads out of the recovery area, past hundreds o people. Doug and Claire look out as they weave past.
Don't worry, baby, Don't worry, baby, Everything will turn out all right... Don’t worry, baby, Everything will turn out all right... They pull out of the lot and drive away. FADE OUT.
